---
status: draft
shortDescription: "Every reference type can be coerced to boolean"
shortCorrection: "Not every reference type can be coerced to boolean"
concepts:
  - Reference
  - Type
  - Boolean
related:
  - id: NumericToBooleanCoercion
    relation: Same, for numeric types
  - id: ReferenceToIntegerConversion
    relation: To number
inOtherPl:
# - pl: JavaScript
#   id: ReferenceToBooleanCoercion
# - pl: Python
#   id: ReferenceToBooleanCoercion
spec:
  - id: jls21
    sections: ["4.2.5", "5.1", "5.1.8"]
plVersion:
# from: jls8
# to: jls14

  - id: ExpressionAsTree
    how: expression involving subexpression of reference type
---

An expression of a reference type can be coerced to `boolean`.
The value `null` becomes `false`, every other value becomes `true`.
This allows conditions like `String s = get(); if (s) ...`.

frontmatter.shortDescription: Every reference type can be coerced to boolean
frontmatter.shortCorrection: Not every reference type can be coerced to boolean
